description: Numbers that are the sum of 4 distinct nonzero squares: of form w^2+x^2+y^2+z^2 with 0<w<x<y<z.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
mathematica: data = Flatten[ DeleteCases[ FindInstance[ w^2 + x^2 + y^2 + z^2 == # && 0 < w < x < y < z < #, {w, x, y, z}, Integers] & /@ Range[137], {}], 1]; w^2 + x^2 + y^2 + z^2 /. data (* From Ant King, Oct 17 2010 *)Select[Union[Total[#^2]&/@Subsets[Range[10],{4}]],#<=137&] (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Jul 03 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)a004433 n = a004433_list !! (n-1)a004433_list = filter (p 4 $ tail a000290_list) [1..] where   p k (q:qs) m = k == 0 && m == 0 ||                  q <= m && k >= 0 && (p (k - 1) qs (m - q) || p k qs m)-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 22 2013
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
